channel.title: [PI] Hint icons
channel.description: I'm creating tutorial. I want that flashing yellow arrow above npc when I log in. After I have spoke to npc I want it gone.

item.title: [PI] Hint icons
item.dc:creator: @matiasmunk matiasmunk
item.description:
@matiasmunk wrote:

Client side or server side?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Hint icons
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Also, you can the frame to an entity, or object with a state of -1 which removes the head hint.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Hint icons
item.dc:creator: @matiasmunk matiasmunk
item.description:
@matiasmunk wrote:

He already managed to place the arrow on the guides head.
But the guide is spawning everytime a player logs in…
So that’d be hundreds of guides in a few minutes…
I believe you have the solution Atomic

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Hint icons
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

There is a frame that you can send to a designated entity, or object that creates an arrow above it.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Hint icons
item.dc:creator: @matiasmunk matiasmunk
item.description:
@matiasmunk wrote:

There should be some tutorials for it… If there’s not, I’ll try and help you.

I don’t know if it lags the server, honestly… But I can try to fix it for you, if you want to?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Hint icons
item.dc:creator: @Broke Broke
item.description:
@Broke wrote:

[quote=“matiasmunk, post:7, topic:444700”]It’s possible to make these npcs only client sided.
So that only the logged on player can see, and no one else can see that npc except their own npc.
The client then sends the packets to the server when clicking the client sided npc.

Don’t know how to do though.[/quote]

Good idea but I don’t know how to make it too. Does this lags server? If i have like 1000 npc’s.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Hint icons
item.dc:creator: @matiasmunk matiasmunk
item.description:
@matiasmunk wrote:

It’s possible to make these npcs only client sided.
So that only the logged on player can see, and no one else can see that npc except their own npc.
The client then sends the packets to the server when clicking the client sided npc.

Don’t know how to do though.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Hint icons
item.dc:creator: @Broke Broke
item.description:
@Broke wrote:

[quote=“matiasmunk, post:5, topic:444700”][quote author=Native^ link=topic=547388.msg4013369#msg4013369 date=1339425814]

If you wanna create a tutorial, you should know how to make this.
Since in a tutorial, you need to explain what the different parts of the code, does, etc etc…
So if it’s your intention to just make a “tutorial” without explaining code.
You’ll most likely be asked to move your thread to the snippet section.

Anyways, I don’t know much about [PI], so I can’t help you there.
But I do know that this will require some, Client Editing & a picture of an arrow in your cache.

Tutorial Island… Not your bad, his.
[/quote]

Oh that makes sense Thank you.

I actually know how to make hint icon my barrows have that already. But the problem is code what barrows use creates new npc but I don’t want that.

Rip the code and change the spawning barrows npc into Tutorial Island Guide instead?
Edit: Don’t forget to change coordinates of the new code you have :P[/quote]

Yeah I tried that but it creates new npc every time player log in. So when 10 players log in I have 10 npcs.

Read full topic
